summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the Jane Does v USA/Epstein case. It discusses filing a supplemental declaration, a non-prosecution agreement filed under seal, and notifications sent to represented victims about work release.

events.title: Draft Supplemental Declaration Prepared
events.description: A draft supplemental declaration was prepared in the Jane Does v USA/Epstein case.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Filed Under Seal
events.description: A lawyer filed a non-prosecution agreement with the court under seal and requested the court to unseal it.

events.title: Notifications Sent to Victims
events.description: Notifications about work release were sent to all represented victims via their attorneys.

keyFacts: The email discusses the Jane Does v USA/Epstein case, indicating ongoing civil litigation against the U.S. government related to Jeffrey Epstein.
A non-prosecution agreement was filed under seal by a lawyer, with a request to the court to unseal it.
Notifications about work release were sent to represented victims via their attorneys on December 5, 2008.
The correspondence is between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office, but all specific names are redacted (shown as USAFLS).
The email suggests coordination on legal filings including a motion for summary judgment and a supplemental declaration.
